00062 // The private method HTTPCache::write_body() could, at one time, throw
00063 // ResponseTooBig to signal that while writing a response body it was found
00064 // to be bigger than the max_entry_size property. But I bagged that; the
00065 // garbage collection methods remove entries larger than max_entry_size. It
00066 // might be that a really big entry belongs in the cache so long as it
00067 // doesn't push other entries out. 10/07/02 jhrg
00068 #ifndef _response_too_big_err_h
00069 #include "ResponseTooBigErr.h"
00070 #endif
00071 
00072 #ifndef _http_cache_disconnected_mode_h
00073 #include "HTTPCacheDisconnectedMode.h"
00074 #endif
00075 
00076 const int CACHE_TABLE_SIZE = 1499;
00077 
00078 using namespace std;
00079 
00137 class HTTPCache {
00138 public:
00150     struct CacheEntry {
00151     string url;     // Location
00152     int hash;
00153     int hits;       // Hit counts
00154 
00155     string cachename;
00156 
00157     string etag;
00158     time_t lm;      // Last modified
00159     time_t expires;
00160     time_t date;        // From the response header.
00161     time_t age;
00162     time_t max_age;     // From Cache-Control
00163 
00164     unsigned long size; // Size of cached entity body
00165     bool range;     // Range is not currently supported. 10/02/02
00166                 // jhrg 
00167 
00168     time_t freshness_lifetime;
00169     time_t response_time;
00170     time_t corrected_initial_age;
00171 
00172     bool must_revalidate;
00173     bool no_cache;      // This field is not saved in the index.
00174     
00175     int locked;
00176 #ifdef HAVE_PTHREAD_H
00177     pthread_mutex_t lock;
00178 #endif
00179     CacheEntry() : url(""), hash(-1), hits(0), cachename(""), 
00180                etag(""), lm(-1),
00181                expires(-1), date(-1), age(-1), max_age(-1), size(0),
00182                range(false), freshness_lifetime(0), response_time(0),
00183                corrected_initial_age(0), must_revalidate(false),
00184                no_cache(false), locked(0)
00185     {}
00186    };
00187 
00188 #ifdef WIN32
00189     //  Declared private below for gcc.  There appears to be a
00190     //  difference in public vs. private under gcc when objects
00191     //  share the same source file (??).
00192     //
00193     // My guess is that this was a bug in older versions of gcc. I've made
00194     // the functors classes (they were structs) and made them friends (so
00195     // they can access private stuff). We should not need this any longer,
00196     // but I'm hesitant to remove it since I cannot easily test with VC++.
00197     // 01/23/04 jhrg
00198     unsigned long d_max_entry_size; // Max individual entry size.
00199 
00200     void remove_cache_entry(CacheEntry *entry) throw(InternalErr);
00201     bool stopGC() const;
00202 #endif
00203 
00204 private:
00205     string d_cache_root;
00206     string d_cache_index;
00207     FILE *d_locked_open_file;   // Lock for single process use.
00208 
00209     bool d_cache_enabled;
00210     bool d_cache_protected;
00211     CacheDisconnectedMode d_cache_disconnected;
00212     bool d_expire_ignored;
00213     bool d_always_validate;
00214 
00215     unsigned long d_total_size; // How much can we store?
00216     unsigned long d_folder_size; // How much of that is meta data?
00217     unsigned long d_gc_buffer;  // How much memory needed as buffer?
00218 #ifndef WIN32  //  Declared public above for win32
00219     unsigned long d_max_entry_size; // Max individual entry size.
00220 #endif
00221     unsigned long d_current_size;
00222     int d_default_expiration;
00223 
00224     vector<string> d_cache_control;
00225     // these are values read from a request-directive Cache-Control header.
00226     // Not to be confused with values read from the response or a cached
00227     // response (e.g., CacheEntry has a max_age field, too). These fields are
00228     // set when the set_cache_control method is called.
00229     time_t d_max_age;
00230     time_t d_max_stale;     // -1: not set, 0:any response, >0 max time.
00231     time_t d_min_fresh;
00232 
00233     int d_new_entries;      // How many entries since index write?
00234 
00235     // Lock non-const methods (also ones that use the STL).
00236 #ifdef HAVE_PTHREAD_H
00237     pthread_mutex_t d_cache_mutex;
00238 #endif
00239 
00240     // Typedefs for CacheTable. A CacheTable is a vector of vectors of
00241     // CacheEntries. The outer vector is accessed using the hash value.
00242     // Entries with matching hashes occupy successive positions in the inner
00243     // vector (that's how hash collisions are resolved). Search the inner
00244     // vector for a specific match.
00245     typedef vector<CacheEntry *> CachePointers;
00246     typedef CachePointers::iterator CachePointersIter;
00247 
00248     // CACHE_TABLE_SIZE is used by the static function get_hash defined in
00249     // HTTPCache.cc. The table is indexed by the various cache entries' hash
00250     // code. 10/01/02 jhrg
00251     typedef CachePointers *CacheTable[CACHE_TABLE_SIZE];
00252 
00253     CacheTable d_cache_table;
00254 
00255     map<FILE *, CacheEntry *> d_locked_entries;
00256 
00257     static HTTPCache *_instance;
00258 
00259     friend class HTTPCacheTest; // Unit tests
00260     
00261     // Functors used with STL algorithms
00262 
00263     friend class DeleteExpired;
00264     friend class DeleteByHits;
00265     friend class DeleteCacheEntry;
00266     friend class DeleteUnlockedCacheEntry;
00267     friend class WriteOneCacheEntry;
00268 
00269     // Private methods
00270 
00271     void clone(const HTTPCache &cache) {}
00272 
00273     HTTPCache(const HTTPCache &cache) { 
00274     clone(cache); 
00275     }
00276     
00277     HTTPCache() {}
00278 
00279     HTTPCache(string cache_root, bool force) throw(Error);
00280 
00281     HTTPCache &operator=(const HTTPCache &rhs) { 
00282     if (this != &rhs)
00283         clone(rhs);
00284     return *this;
00285     }
00286 
00287     static void delete_instance(); // Run by atexit (hence static)
00288     
00289     CacheEntry *cache_index_parse_line(const char *line);
00290     bool cache_index_read();
00291     bool cache_index_delete();
00292

00294 
00295     bool get_single_user_lock(bool force = false);
00296     void release_single_user_lock();
00297 
00298     void add_entry_to_cache_table(CacheEntry *e);
00299     void remove_entry_from_cache_table(const string &url) throw(InternalErr);
00300     void parse_headers(CacheEntry *entry, const vector<string> &headers);
00301     void calculate_time (CacheEntry *entry, time_t request_time);
00302 #ifndef WIN32  //  Declared public above for win32
00303     void remove_cache_entry(CacheEntry *entry) throw(InternalErr);
00304 #endif
00305     CacheEntry *get_entry_from_cache_table(const string &url) const;
00306     CacheEntry *get_entry_from_cache_table(int hash, const string &url) const;

00308     // I made these four methods so they could be tested by HTTPCacheTest.
00309     // Otherwise they would be static functions in HTTPCache.cc. 10/01/02
00310     // jhrg
00311     void write_metadata(const string &cachename, const vector<string> &headers)
00312     throw(InternalErr);
00313     void read_metadata(const string &cachename, vector<string> &headers) 
00314     const throw(InternalErr);
00315     int write_body(const string &cachename, const FILE *src) 
00316     throw(InternalErr, ResponseTooBigErr);
00317     FILE *open_body(const string &cachename) const throw(InternalErr);
00318 
00319     void create_cache_root(const string &cache_root) throw(Error);
00320 
00321     string create_hash_directory(int hash) throw(Error);
00322     void create_location(CacheEntry *entry) throw(Error);

00324 #ifndef WIN32  //  Declared public above for win32
00325     bool stopGC() const;
00326 #endif

00388 // Revision 1.4  2004/02/05 06:51:16  jimg
00388 // Added/update.
00388 //
00389 // Revision 1.8.2.6  2004/01/23 22:03:49  jimg
00390 // Fixed some comments after testing.
00391 //
00392 // Revision 1.8.2.5  2004/01/22 20:47:24  jimg
00393 // Fix for bug 689. I added tests to make sure the cache size doesn't wind
00394 // up being set to a negative number. I also changed the types of the cache
00395 // size and entry size from int to unsigned long. Added information to
00396 // the default .dodsrc file explaining the units of the CACHE_SIZE and
00397 // MAX_ENTRY_SIZE parameters.
00398 //
00399 // Revision 1.8.2.4  2003/09/08 18:52:08  jimg
00400 // The cache_response() method now declares that it may throw an InternalErr. It
00401 // calls create_location() which, due to bug #661, could not create the location
00402 // and threw an InternalErr. Since cache_response didn't declare InternalErr,
00403 // abort() was called.
00404 //
00405 // Revision 1.8.2.3  2003/07/11 04:25:22  jimg
00406 // Changed friend struct ... to friend class ... to match changes in the
00407 // implementation. I think this will fix a build problem with win32, so
00408 // one of the #ifdef WIN32 blocks can be removed.
00409 //
00410 // Revision 1.8.2.2  2003/06/23 11:49:18  rmorris
00411 // The #pragma interface directive to GCC makes the dynamic typing functionality
00412 // go completely haywire under OS X on the PowerPC.  We can't use that directive
00413 // on that platform and it was ifdef'd out for that case.
00414 //
00415 // Revision 1.8.2.1  2003/06/15 01:44:33  rmorris
00416 // VC++ appears to have access rules different then gcc.  It appears that
00417 // gcc allows external access to private data members when another object
00418 // making that access is declared  in the same source file.  Several data members
00419 // and functions that were private were #ifdef'd to public under win32.  Several
00420 // other "friend struct" members were also defined elsewhere as classes and
00421 // gcc permitted it while VC++ does not.  These friends were ifdef'd out as
00422 // that appears just to be code in transition.
00423 //
00424 // Revision 1.8  2003/04/23 21:33:53  jimg
00425 // Changes for the unit tests. This involved merging Rob's VC++ changes
00426 // and fixing a bug in escaping.cc (a call to string::insert invalidated
00427 // an iterator in a loop).
00428 //
00429 // Revision 1.7  2003/04/22 19:40:27  jimg
00430 // Merged with 3.3.1.
00431 //
00432 // Revision 1.6  2003/03/13 23:53:55  jimg
00433 // Fixed documentation. Added #include "config_dap.h" which will have to be
00434 // removed somehow, after hacking up the configure script. removed the const
00435 // qualifier from some methods because they lock a mutex. These could be marked
00436 // const volatile, but I bet there are a lot of compilers that don't support
00437 // that yet...

00490 // probably require that it become a singleton, but maybe not), protect
00491 // all non-const methods with a mutex and devise a locking strategy so that
